I fixed the NullPointerException. As for the original bug, there is nothing SWT
can do. The GTK input method is eating the keys Crtl+Shift A through F to
generate unicode hex values.

I'm pretty sure this is a "new" bug that's appeared in recent weeks. But maybe we just changed our 
default keybinding to something that hits the problem? Kevin, do you remember if we used to use 
something other than ctrl+shift+d?

There have been some changes in this realm, but the keybinding hasn't changed 
at all. If GTK is swallowing Ctrl-Shift A-F, how did Display ever work? Do we 
need a new Key Sequence for GTK users? Does the command work if you map it to 
a different key sequence?

My previous comment was wrong. Jared was referring to an old binding to 
the 'enter' key. That was possible only because we defined our own "debug 
popup" context. That context is gone and now the popup reuses the keybinding 
that activated it by creating a new IHandler. That change was made in the 
final week leading to M8. Does that timing sound right to you Jared?

In any case, if the popup's aren't working in GTK it seems this bug should be 
reopened and reassigned to the debug team for further investigation.
Agreed. No matter what the cause, the pop-ups are currently broken on GTK.

Would it be possible to provide some way to send the dialog to the view using the mouse? Ideally, 
the text at the bottom of the pop-up would just be a hyperlink.

That's probably possible. Right now it's just a label down there. If "Ctrl-
Shift-D" doesn't work, doesn't it make sense to provide a different key 
sequence to GTK users that does work? (Ctrl-Shift-V for View??)
probably the best answer is "do both"

Changed keybinding on the gtk platform to "Ctrl-Shift-V" as work around to GTK eating Ctrl-Shift-D on 
us.
Filed Bug 60820 to investigate adding hyperlink support in the future.
